documentation.text: Article struct - Metadata about an article

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You must be a verified publisher"

arguments.value: You must be a verified publisher

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You must be a verified publisher"

documentation.text:
Register a new article
 
 Flow:
 1. Publisher calls this with article hash
 2. Contract checks: Is caller a verified publisher?
 3. Contract checks: Was this article already registered?
 4. Contract stores: hash, publisher, time, language
 
 @param _contentHash SHA-256 hash of article (32 bytes)
 @param _language Language code (e.g., "hindi")
 
 Example from Python:
 hash = hashlib.sha256(article_text.encode()).digest()
 contract.registerArticle(hash, "hindi")
Get total number of registered articles

params._language: Language code (e.g., "hindi")  Example from Python: hash = hashlib.sha256(article_text.encode()).digest() contract.registerArticle(hash, "hindi")

returns.timestamp: When was it published?  Anyone can call this (public verification)  Example: hash = hashlib.sha256("fake article text".encode()).digest() exists, publisher, time = contract.verifyArticle(hash) if exists:     print(f"Article was published by {publisher} on {time}")

returns._0: bool True if this publisher posted this article

getArticleCount().notice: Get total number of registered articles

registerArticle(bytes32,string).notice: Register a new article  Flow: 1. Publisher calls this with article hash 2. Contract checks: Is caller a verified publisher? 3. Contract checks: Was this article already registered? 4. Contract stores: hash, publisher, time, language

verifyArticle(bytes32).notice: Verify if article exists and get details

wasPublishedBy(bytes32,address).notice: Check if article was published by specific publisher
